did.abstract: Materials in this collection include a history of the department, reports, By-Laws, lectures, publications, plaques, negatives and other materials. The collection covers the years 1969-97.

prefercite.head: Preferred citation
prefercite.p: Computer Medicine Department records, Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquisition data is unknown for this collection.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

bioghist.head: Historical or Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Computer Medicine Department was part of the School of Medicine and Health Sciences. It appears to have been a part of the school from 1984-99.

Computer medicine traces the development of computer applications to medical research and practice. Computer Medicine includes aspects of computer use, including preparation and execution of programs that involve clinical or research applications, such as EEG analysis, medical file management, mathematical modeling, data processing, and managerial computing.

scopecontent.head: Collection Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Materials in this collection include a history of the department, reports, bylaws, lectures, publications, plaques, negatives, and other materials. The collection covers the years 1969-97.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains a history of the department, reports, by-laws, lectures, publications, plaque, and negatives. The material covers the dates 1969-97.
This series has a paper container list in the reading room, please ask staff for assistance.
